com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting

Class FiscalYear

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting.FiscalYear

  • public class FiscalYear
extends java.lang.Object
    A data transfer object containing data about a fiscal year, an accounting period defined by a start date and end date. The fiscal year may be a calendar year (Jan. 1 - Dec. 31) or any arbitrary annual period.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

      private java.sql.Timestamp start
      the date and time at which the fiscal year starts
      private java.util.Map<Account,java.util.Set<Transaction>> transactionMap
      a map of sets of transactions for each account, indexed on account
      private java.util.Set<Transaction> transactions
      the set of transactions in the fiscal year; each acocunt must exist in the set of accounts for the fiscal year
      private java.lang.Integer year
      the name of the fiscal year; usually the calendar year of the start date

      • addTransaction

        public void addTransaction(Transaction transaction)
        Add a transaction to the fiscal year, adding it to the set of transactions and indexing the transactions by item accounts to optimize rollup.
        Parameters:
        transaction - the transaction to add

      • isIn

        public java.lang.Boolean isIn(java.sql.Timestamp date)
        Is a date in the fiscal year? That means the date is between the start date and the end date, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        date - the timestamp to test against the start and end dates
        Returns:
        true if the date is within the year, false if not

      • getAccounts

        public java.util.Set<Account> getAccounts()
        Get a threadsafe version of the set of accounts.
        Returns:
        a threadsafe set of the accounts in the fiscal year

      • addAccount

        public void addAccount(Account account)
        Add an account to the fiscal year. Also add the fiscal year to the account if it's not already there.
        Parameters:
        account - the account to add
